column1: '''''Middle-earth Online''''' was the title of a game that [[Sierra Entertainment
column2: Sierra]] was devoloping in 1998. Sierra was then bought out by [[Vivendi
column3: Vivendi Universal Games]] in 1999. Vivendi agreed to jointly produce the game with [[Turbine]] in 2003. Vivendi abandonded the project and sold the rights to the game exclusively to Turbine March 2004. Turbine announced that the name of the game would be changed from ''Middle-earth Online'' to ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]''.
